noun.description: The alteration of something from its original course, meaning, or state to a distortion or corruption of what was first intended.
examples: a scandalous perversion of the law
all great evil is the perversion of a good

noun.description: Sexual behavior or desire that is considered abnormal or unacceptable.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin perversio(n-), from the verb pervertere turn about (see pervert).
